poem:
Title: Brisk Beats on Urban Streets

In the boroughs where quiet grows,
Through the car's thunderous throes,
Walkers and peddlers, they now own,
Each cobble, kerb, and twilight stone.
With each step, lungs in chorus sing,
A hundred-fold gains those schemes do bring,
Public health borne on foot-tread dreams,
In the silent applause of Low-Traffic schemes.
